Investigators found more than 100 animal carcasses scattered around the property of a woman who once ran a kennel from her house.
Mary Meekins of Rowland faces about 150 counts of cruelty to animals and several other charges, said Katherine Floyd, the equine- and animal-cruelty investigator for Robeson County.
Investigators first searched the property Sunday and found piles of bones and shallow graves along with the carcasses. They returned Monday to impound the remaining live animals and search for the dead ones.
